Package org.firmata4j.ssd1306

Class MonochromeCanvas

java.lang.Object
org.firmata4j.ssd1306.MonochromeCanvas
public class MonochromeCanvas extends Object
This is monochrome 1-bit-per-pixel canvas that allows to draw basic graphical shapes, characters, strings and bitmaps.
It was inspired by Adafruit GFX library.
Author:
Oleg Kurbatov <o.v.kurbatov@gmail.com> see https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit-GFX-Library

    • drawBitmap

      public void drawBitmap(int x, int y, byte[][] bitmap, boolean opaque)
      Draws a bitmap. Each byte of data contains values for 8 consecutive pixels in a row.
      Parameters:
      x -
      y -
      bitmap - data to display. Each bit stands for a pixel.
      opaque - if true, 0 - bits is drawn in background color, if false - the color of corresponding pixel doesn't change

    • drawImage

      public void drawImage(int x, int y, BufferedImage image, boolean opaque, boolean invert)
      Draws an image. The image is grayscalled before drawing.
      Parameters:
      x -
      y -
      image - an image to draw
      opaque - if true, 0 - bits is drawn in background color, if false - the color of corresponding pixel doesn't change
      invert - true to make dark pixels of the image be drawn as bright pixels on screen
